title: Drawing, "Design for Architectural Motif", ca. 1710
medium: Red chalk, pen and brown ink on paper, lined
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux; acquired by him after 1906.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Within a semi-circular architectural niche an eagle, wings outspread, rests on a socle, before which is suspended a wreath.  Smoke rises in the background; an arch above, and volute brackets at either side.  Ink framing lines.  On verso, written: "Babel."

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Architectural Motif", ca. 1710.
ca. 1710. Red chalk, pen and brown ink on paper, lined. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-238.
